Jersey_City.White Eagle Hall:
White Eagle Hall is a music, theatre, and dining venue in a restored historic building in the Village neighborhood of Downtown Jersey City, New Jersey, located on Newark Avenue. Originally built in 1910 as community center and used for events as bingo games, dance recitals, and concerts, and later as basketball practice hall, it has been restored as performing arts, gallery space, and restaurant complex.


== Construction and architecture ==
The white eagle is part of the coat of arms of Poland.
